model.chip_description:
S3C44B0X Based on Samsung's datasheet ver. 1.21, DEC.19.2001
Developed by: Dept. Computer Architecture and Systems Engineering Faculty of Computer Science Univ. Complutense de Madrid http://informatica.ucm.es/ (DEC.17.2013)

register.name: BWSCON
register.description: Bus Width and Wait Status Control Register

field.name: ST7
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 7

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS7
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 7 (If bank7 has DRAM or SDRAM, WAIT function is not supported)

field.name: DW7
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 7

field.name: ST6
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 6

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS6
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 6 (If bank6 has DRAM or SDRAM, WAIT function is not supported)

field.name: DW6
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 6

field.name: ST5
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 5

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS5
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 5

field.name: DW5
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 5

field.name: ST4
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 4

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS4
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 4

field.name: DW4
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 4

field.name: ST3
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 3

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS3
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 3

field.name: DW3
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 3

field.name: ST2
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 2

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS2
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 2

field.name: DW2
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 2

field.name: ST1
field.description: This bit determines SRAM for using UB/LB for bank 1

interpretation.text: Not using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nWBE[3:0] )
Using UB/LB ( Pin[14:11] is dedicated nBE[3:0] )

field.name: WS1
field.description: This bit determines WAIT status for bank 1

field.name: DW1
field.description: These two bits determine data bus width for bank 1

field.name: DW0
field.description: Indicates data bus width for bank 0 (read only)

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: Tpac
field.description: Page mode access cycle @ Page mode

field.name: MT
field.description: These two bits determine the memory type for bank6

field.name: MT
field.description: These two bits determine the memory type for bank7

field.name: SCLKEN
field.description: SCLK will be generated only during SDRAM access cycle. This feature will reduce the power consumption.

register.name: MRSRB6
register.description: Mode register set register bank6 (just for DRAM/EDO-DRAM, MT=01/10)

register.name: MRSRB7
register.description: Mode register set register bank7 (just for DRAM/EDO-DRAM, MT=01/10)

registergroup.name: CLK-PWR
registergroup.description: Clock generator and power management Registers

field.name: IDLE BIT
field.description: Enters IDLE mode. This bit can't be cleared automatically

field.name: SL_IDLE
field.description: SL_IDLE mode option. This bit can't be cleared automatically

field.name: STOP BIT
field.description: Enters STOP mode. This bit can't be cleared automatically

interpretation.text: Fout = Fin / (2 x SLOW_VAL), (SLOW_VAL > 0); Fout = Fin, (SLOW_VAL = 0)

field.name: SLOW_VAL
field.description: The divider value for the slow clock when SLOW_BIT is on

field.name: DA(reserved)
field.description: DATA ABORT controls. This bit is recommended to be 0

field.name: RSE(reserved)
field.description: Enable read stall option. This bit is recommended to be 0

field.name: WE
field.description: This bit determines write buffer enable / disable

field.name: CM
field.description: These two bits determine cache mode

interpretation.text: Half cache enable (4KB cache, 4KB internal SRAM)

field.name: SE
field.description: Enable stall option. This bit is recommended to be 0

register.name: NCACHBE0
register.description: Start address and end address of non-cacheable area 0

field.name: SE0
field.description: End address of non-cacheable area 0. SE0 = (End address + 1)/4K

field.name: SA0
field.description: Start address of non-cacheable area 0. SA0 = Start address/4K

register.name: NCACHBE1
register.description: Start address and end address of non-cacheable area 1

field.name: SE1
field.description: End address of non-cacheable area 1. SE1 = (End address + 1)/4K

field.name: SA1
field.description: Start address of non-cacheable area 0. SA1 = Start address/4K

register.name: SBUSCON
register.description: Determines the bus priorities among the bus masters

field.name: S_LCD_DMA
field.description: Indicates the LCD_DMA bus priority (read only)

field.name: S_ZDMA
field.description: Indicates the ZDMA bus priority (read only)

field.name: S_BDMA
field.description: Indicates the BDMA bus priority (read only)

field.name: S_nBREQ
field.description: Indicates the nBREQ bus priority (read only)

interpretation.text: Starts DMA operation by S/W without nXDREQ

field.name: OPT
field.description: DMA internal options. OPT = 10 is recommended

interpretation.text: DMA does word-swap or half-word swap

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

field.name: OPT
field.description: DMA internal options. OPT = 10 is recommended

interpretation.text: DMA does word-swap or half-word swap

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

interpretation.text: Starts DMA operation by S/W without nXDREQ

field.name: OPT
field.description: DMA internal options. OPT = 10 is recommended

interpretation.text: DMA does word-swap or half-word swap

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

field.name: OPT
field.description: DMA internal options. OPT = 10 is recommended

interpretation.text: DMA does word-swap or half-word swap

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

field.name: QDS
field.description: Disable/Enable External/Internal DMA request (UARTn, SIO, IIS, Timer)

interpretation.text: M2IO (from external memory to internal peripheral)
IO2M (from internal peripheral to external memory)
IO2IO (from internal peripheral to internal peripheral)

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

interpretation.text: M2IO (from external memory to internal peripheral)
IO2M (from internal peripheral to external memory)
IO2IO (from internal peripheral to internal peripheral)

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

field.name: QDS
field.description: Disable/Enable External/Internal DMA request (UARTn, SIO, IIS, Timer)

interpretation.text: M2IO (from external memory to internal peripheral)
IO2M (from internal peripheral to external memory)
IO2IO (from internal peripheral to internal peripheral)

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

interpretation.text: M2IO (from external memory to internal peripheral)
IO2M (from internal peripheral to external memory)
IO2IO (from internal peripheral to internal peripheral)

field.name: AR
field.description: Auto-reload and Auto-start after DMA count are 0

register.name: PCONA
register.description: Configures the pins of port A

register.name: PDATA
register.description: The data register for port A

register.name: PCONB
register.description: Configures the pins of port B

register.name: PDATB
register.description: The data register for port B

register.name: PCONC
register.description: Configures the pins of port C

register.name: PDATC
register.description: The data register for port C

register.name: PUPC
register.description: Pull-up disable register for port C

register.name: PCOND
register.description: Configures the pins of port D

register.name: PDATD
register.description: The data register for port D

register.name: PUPD
register.description: Pull-up disable register for port D

register.name: PCONE
register.description: Configures the pins of port E

register.name: PDATE
register.description: The data register for port E

register.name: PUPE
register.description: Pull-up disable register for port E

register.name: PCONF
register.description: Configures the pins of port F

register.name: PDATF
register.description: The data register for port F

register.name: PUPF
register.description: Pull-up disable register for port F

register.name: PCONG
register.description: Configures the pins of port G

register.name: PDATG
register.description: The data register for port G

register.name: PUPG
register.description: Pull-up disable register for port G

interpretation.text: DATA[15:8] port pull-up resistor is enabled
DATA[15:8] port pull-up resistor is disabled
DATA[7:0] port pull-up resistor is enabled
DATA[7:0] port pull-up resistor is disabled

field.name: EXTINTPND3
field.description: If EINT7 is activated, EXINTPND3 bit is set to 1, and also INTPND[21] is set to 1.

field.name: EXTINTPND2
field.description: If EINT6 is activated, EXINTPND2 bit is set to 1, and also INTPND[21] is set to 1.

field.name: EXTINTPND1
field.description: If EINT5 is activated, EXINTPND1 bit is set to 1, and also INTPND[21] is set to 1.

field.name: EXTINTPND0
field.description: If EINT4 is activated, EXINTPND0 bit is set to 1, and also INTPND[21] is set to 1.

field.name: Dead zone length
field.description: These 8 bits determine the dead zone length

field.name: Prescaler 2
field.description: These 8 bits determine prescaler value for Timer 4 and 5

field.name: Prescaler 1
field.description: These 8 bits determine prescaler value for Timer 2 and 3

field.name: Prescaler 0
field.description: These 8 bits determine prescaler value for Timer 0 and 1

field.name: MUX 5
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer5

field.name: MUX 4
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer4

field.name: MUX 3
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer3

field.name: MUX 2
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer2

field.name: MUX 1
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer1

field.name: MUX 0
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer0

field.name: Timer 5 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 5

field.name: Timer 5 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 5

field.name: Timer 5 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 5

field.name: Timer 4 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 4

field.name: Timer 4 output inverter on/off
field.description: This bit determines output inverter on/off for Timer 4

field.name: Timer 4 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 4

field.name: Timer 4 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 4

field.name: Timer 3 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 3

field.name: Timer 3 output inverter on/off
field.description: This bit determines output inverter on/off for Timer 3

field.name: Timer 3 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 3

field.name: Timer 3 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 3

field.name: Timer 2 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 2

field.name: Timer 2 output inverter on/off
field.description: This bit determines output inverter on/off for Timer 2

field.name: Timer 2 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 2

field.name: Timer 2 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 2

field.name: Timer 1 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 1

field.name: Timer 1 output inverter on/off
field.description: This bit determines output inverter on/off for Timer 1

field.name: Timer 1 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 1

field.name: Timer 1 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 1

field.name: Dead zone enable
field.description: This bit determines the dead zone operation

field.name: Timer 0 auto reload on/off
field.description: This bit determines auto reload on/off for Timer 0

field.name: Timer 0 output inverter on/off
field.description: This bit determines output inverter on/off for Timer 0

field.name: Timer 0 manual update
field.description: This bit determines the manual update for Timer 0

field.name: Timer 0 start/stop
field.description: This bit determines start/stop for Timer 0

field.name: Infra-Red Mode
field.description: The Infra-Red mode determines whether or not to use the Infra-Red mode

field.name: Parity Mode
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer5

field.name: Number of stop bit
field.description: The number of stop bits specifies how many stop bits are to be used to signal end-of-frame

field.name: Word length
field.description: The word length indicates the number of data bits to be transmitted or received per frame

interpretation.text: Pulse (Interrupt is requested the instant Tx buffer becomes empty)
Level (Interrupt is requested while Tx buffer is empty)
Pulse (Interrupt is requested the instant Rx buffer receives the data)
Level (Interrupt is requested while Rx buffer is receiving data)

field.name: Rx time out enable
field.description: Enable/Disable Rx time out interrupt when UART FIFO is enabled. The interrupt is a receive interrupt

field.name: Rx error status interrupt enable
field.description: This bit enables the UART to generate an interrupt if an exception, such as a break, frame error, parity error, or overrun error occurs during a receive operation

interpretation.text: Do not generate receive error status interrupt

field.name: Loop-back Mode
field.description: Setting loop-back bit to 1 causes the UART to enter the loopback mode. This mode is provided for test purposes only.

field.name: Send Break Signal
field.description: Setting this bit causes the UART to send a break during 1 frame time. This bit is auto-cleared after sending the break signal.

field.name: Transmit Mode
field.description: These two bits determine which function is currently able to write Tx data to the UART transmit holding register

field.name: Receive Mode
field.description: These two bits determine which function is currently able to read data from UART receive buffer register.

field.name: Tx FIFO Trigger Level
field.description: These two bits determine the trigger level of transmit FIFO

field.name: Rx FIFO Trigger Level
field.description: These two bits determine the trigger level of receive FIFO

field.name: Tx FIFO Reset
field.description: This bit is auto-cleared after resetting FIFO

field.name: Request to Send
field.description: If AFC bit is enabled, this value will be ignored. In this case the S3C44B0X will control nRTS automatically. If AFC bit is disabled, nRTS must be controlled by S/W

field.name: Transmit shifter empty
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 when the transmit shift register has no valid data to transmit and the transmit shift register is empty

interpretation.text: Transmit holding and shifter register empty

field.name: Transmit buffer empty
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 when the transmit buffer register does not contain valid data

interpretation.text: The buffer register is not empty

field.name: Receive buffer data ready
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever the receive buffer register contains valid data, received over the RXDn port

interpretation.text: The buffer register has a received data

register.name: UERSTAT0
register.description: UART channel 0 Rx error status register

field.name: Break Detect
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 to indicate that a break signal has been received

field.name: Frame Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever a frame error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Parity Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever a parity error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Overrun Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever an overrun error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Tx FIFO Full
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever transmit FIFO is full during transmit operation

field.name: Rx FIFO Full
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever receive FIFO is full during receive operation

field.name: Tx FIFO Count
field.description: Number of data in Tx FIFO

field.name: Rx FIFO Count
field.description: Number of data in Rx FIFO

field.name: Delta CTS
field.description: This bit indicates that the nCTS input to S3C44B0X has changed state since the last time it was read by CPU

interpretation.text: CTS signal is not activated(nCTS pin is high)
CTS signal is activated(nCTS pin is low)

field.name: Infra-Red Mode
field.description: The Infra-Red mode determines whether or not to use the Infra-Red mode

field.name: Parity Mode
field.description: Select MUX input for PWM Timer5

field.name: Number of stop bit
field.description: The number of stop bits specifies how many stop bits are to be used to signal end-of-frame

field.name: Word length
field.description: The word length indicates the number of data bits to be transmitted or received per frame

interpretation.text: Pulse (Interrupt is requested the instant Tx buffer becomes empty)
Level (Interrupt is requested while Tx buffer is empty)
Pulse (Interrupt is requested the instant Rx buffer receives the data)
Level (Interrupt is requested while Rx buffer is receiving data)

field.name: Rx time out enable
field.description: Enable/Disable Rx time out interrupt when UART FIFO is enabled. The interrupt is a receive interrupt

field.name: Rx error status interrupt enable
field.description: This bit enables the UART to generate an interrupt if an exception, such as a break, frame error, parity error, or overrun error occurs during a receive operation

interpretation.text: Do not generate receive error status interrupt

field.name: Loop-back Mode
field.description: Setting loop-back bit to 1 causes the UART to enter the loopback mode. This mode is provided for test purposes only.

field.name: Send Break Signal
field.description: Setting this bit causes the UART to send a break during 1 frame time. This bit is auto-cleared after sending the break signal.

field.name: Transmit Mode
field.description: These two bits determine which function is currently able to write Tx data to the UART transmit holding register

field.name: Receive Mode
field.description: These two bits determine which function is currently able to read data from UART receive buffer register.

field.name: Tx FIFO Trigger Level
field.description: These two bits determine the trigger level of transmit FIFO

field.name: Rx FIFO Trigger Level
field.description: These two bits determine the trigger level of receive FIFO

field.name: Tx FIFO Reset
field.description: This bit is auto-cleared after resetting FIFO

field.name: Request to Send
field.description: If AFC bit is enabled, this value will be ignored. In this case the S3C44B0X will control nRTS automatically. If AFC bit is disabled, nRTS must be controlled by S/W

field.name: Transmit shifter empty
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 when the transmit shift register has no valid data to transmit and the transmit shift register is empty

interpretation.text: Transmit holding and shifter register empty

field.name: Transmit buffer empty
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 when the transmit buffer register does not contain valid data

interpretation.text: The buffer register is not empty

field.name: Receive buffer data ready
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever the receive buffer register contains valid data, received over the RXDn port

interpretation.text: The buffer register has a received data

register.name: UERSTAT1
register.description: UART channel 1 Rx error status register

field.name: Break Detect
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 to indicate that a break signal has been received

field.name: Frame Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever a frame error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Parity Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever a parity error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Overrun Error
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever an overrun error occurs during receive operation

field.name: Tx FIFO Full
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever transmit FIFO is full during transmit operation

field.name: Rx FIFO Full
field.description: This bit is automatically set to 1 whenever receive FIFO is full during receive operation

field.name: Tx FIFO Count
field.description: Number of data in Tx FIFO

field.name: Rx FIFO Count
field.description: Number of data in Rx FIFO

field.name: Delta CTS
field.description: This bit indicates that the nCTS input to S3C44B0X has changed state since the last time it was read by CPU

interpretation.text: CTS signal is not activated(nCTS pin is high)
CTS signal is activated(nCTS pin is low)

field.name: V
field.description: This bit disables/enables vector mode for IRQ

field.name: I
field.description: This bit enables IRQ interrupt request line to CPU

field.name: F
field.description: This bit enables FIQ interrupt request line to CPU

field.name: PSLAVE@mGA-sGA (EINT0)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGA

field.name: PSLAVE@mGA-sGB (EINT1)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGA

field.name: PSLAVE@mGA-sGC (EINT2)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGA

field.name: PSLAVE@mGA-sGD (EINT3)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGA

field.name: PSLAVE@mGB-sGA (INT_ZDMA0)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGB

field.name: PSLAVE@mGB-sGB (INT_ZDMA1)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGB

field.name: PSLAVE@mGB-sGC (INT_BDMA0)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGB

field.name: PSLAVE@mGB-sGD (INT_BDMA1)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGB

field.name: PSLAVE@mGC-sGA (TIMER0)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGC

field.name: PSLAVE@mGC-sGB (TIMER1)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGC

field.name: PSLAVE@mGC-sGC (TIMER2)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGC

field.name: PSLAVE@mGC-sGD (TIMER3)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGC

field.name: PSLAVE@mGD-sGA (INT_URXD0)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGD

field.name: PSLAVE@mGD-sGB (INT_URXD1)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGD

field.name: PSLAVE@mGD-sGC (INT_IIC)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGD

field.name: PSLAVE@mGD-sGD (INT_SIO)
field.description: Determine the priorities among sGA, B, C, D of mGD

field.name: FxSLVA
field.description: Determines the operating mode of slave unit @mGA

field.name: FxSLVB
field.description: Determines the operating mode of slave unit @mGB

field.name: FxSLVC
field.description: Determines the operating mode of slave unit @mGC

field.name: FxSLVD
field.description: Determines the operating mode of slave unit @mGD

field.name: PMASTER-mGA
field.description: Determine the priorities among 4 slave units

field.name: PMASTER-mGB
field.description: Determine the priorities among 4 slave units

field.name: PMASTER-mGC
field.description: Determine the priorities among 4 slave units

field.name: PMASTER-mGD
field.description: Determine the priorities among 4 slave units

register.name: I_CSLV
register.description: Current IRQ priority of slave register

field.name: CSLAVE@mGA-sGA (EINT0)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGA

field.name: CSLAVE@mGA-sGB (EINT1)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGA

field.name: CSLAVE@mGA-sGC (EINT2)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGA

field.name: CSLAVE@mGA-sGD (EINT3)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGA

field.name: CSLAVE@mGB-sGA (INT_ZDMA0)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGB

field.name: CSLAVE@mGB-sGB (INT_ZDMA1)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGB

field.name: CSLAVE@mGB-sGC (INT_BDMA0)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGB

field.name: CSLAVE@mGB-sGD (INT_BDMA1)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGB

field.name: CSLAVE@mGC-sGA (TIMER0)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGC

field.name: CSLAVE@mGC-sGB (TIMER1)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGC

field.name: CSLAVE@mGC-sGC (TIMER2)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGC

field.name: CSLAVE@mGC-sGD (TIMER3)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGC

field.name: CSLAVE@mGD-sGA (INT_URXD0)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGD

field.name: CSLAVE@mGD-sGB (INT_URXD1)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGD

field.name: SLAVE@mGD-sGC (INT_IIC)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGD

field.name: PSLAVE@mGD-sGD (INT_SIO)
field.description: Indicate the current priority status of mGD

register.name: I_CMST
register.description: Current IRQ priority of master register

field.name: VECTOR
field.description: The lower 6 bits of corresponding branch machine code

register.name: I_ISPC
register.description: IRQ interrupt service pending clear register

register.name: F_ISPC
register.description: FIQ interrupt service pending clear register

field.name: LINECNT
field.description: These bits provide the status of the line counter

field.name: CLKVAL
field.description: These bits determine the rate of VCLK

field.name: WLH
field.description: These bits determine the VLINE pulse's high level width by counting the number of the system clock

field.name: WDLY
field.description: These bits determine the delay between VLINE and VCLK by counting the number of the system clock

field.name: MMODE
field.description: This bit determines the toggle rate of the VM

interpretation.text: The rate defined by the MVAL

field.name: DISMODE
field.description: These bits select the display mode

field.name: INVCLK
field.description: This bit controls the polarity of the VCLK active edge

interpretation.text: The video data is fetched at VCLK falling edge
The video data is fetched at VCLK rising edge

field.name: INVLINE
field.description: This bit indicates the line pulse polarity

field.name: INVFRAME
field.description: This bit indicates the line pulse polarity

field.name: INVVD
field.description: This bit indicates the video data(VD[7:0]) polarity

field.name: ENVID
field.description: LCD video output and the logic enable/disable

interpretation.text: Disable the video output and the logic. The LCD FIFO is cleared
Enable the video output and the logic

field.name: LINEBLANK
field.description: These bits indicate the blank time in one horizontal line duration time

field.name: HOZVAL
field.description: These bits determine the horizontal size of the LCD panel

field.name: LINEVAL
field.description: These bits determine the vertical size of LCD panel

field.name: SELFREF
field.description: LCD self refresh mode enable bit

field.name: MODESEL
field.description: These bits select the monochrome, gray, or color mode

field.name: LCDBANK
field.description: These bits indicate A[27:22] of the bank location for the video buffer in the system memory

field.name: LCDBASEU
field.description: These bits indicate A[21:1] of the start address of the upper address counter

field.name: MVAL
field.description: These bits define the rate at which the VM signal will toggle if the MMODE bit is set to logic '1'.

field.name: LCDBASEL
field.description: These bits indicate A[21:1] of the start address of the lower address counter

field.name: OFFSIZE
field.description: Virtual screen offset size(the number of half words)

field.name: PAGEWIDTH
field.description: Virtual screen page width(the number of half words)

field.name: REDVAL
field.description: These bits define which of the 16 shades each of the 8 possible red combinations will choose

field.name: GREENVAL
field.description: These bits define which of the 16 shades each of the 8 possible green combinations will choose

field.name: BLUEVAL
field.description: These bits define which of the 16 shades each of the 8 possible blue combinations will choose

interpretation.text: A/D conversion starts and this bit is cleared after the start-up

field.name: SECCR
field.description: Round boundary for second carry generation

interpretation.text: This two bits must be 00 in normal operation

field.name: Watchdog timer enable/disable
field.description: Enable or disable bit of watchdog timer

field.name: Interrupt enable/disable
field.description: Enable or disable bit of the interrupt

interpretation.text: This bit must be 0 in normal operation

field.name: Reset enable disable
field.description: Enable or disable bit of watchdog timer output for reset signal

interpretation.text: Reset function of the watchdog timer disabled
Reset function of the watchdog timer enabled

field.name: Count reload value
field.description: Watchdog timer count value for reload

field.name: Count value
field.description: The current count value of the watchdog timer

field.name: Tx clock source selection
field.description: Source clock of IIC-bus transmit clock prescaler selection bit

interpretation.text: No interrupt pending(when read) / Clear pending condition and Resume the operation (when write)
Interrupt is pending (when read) / N/A (when write)

field.name: Mode selection
field.description: IIC-bus master/slave Tx/Rx mode select bits

interpretation.text: read) IIC-bus not busy (when read) / write) IIC-bus STOP signal generation
read) IIC-bus busy (when read) / write) IIC-bus START signal generation

field.name: Arbitration status flag
field.description: IIC-bus arbitration procedure status flag bit

interpretation.text: Bus arbitration failed during serial I/O
Cleared when START/STOP condition was detected
Received slave address matches the address value in the IICADD

field.name: Address zero status flag
field.description: IIC-bus address zero status flag bit

interpretation.text: Cleared when START/STOP condition was detected

field.name: Last-received bit status flag
field.description: IIC-bus last-received bit status flag bit

interpretation.text: Last-receive bit is 1 (ACK was not received)

field.name: Slave address
field.description: 7-bit slave address, latched from the IIC-bus

field.name: Data shift
field.description: 8-bit data shift register for IIC-bus Tx/Rx operation

interpretation.text: Master mode (IISLRCK and IISCLK are output mode)
Slave mode (IISLRCK and IISCLK are input mode)
Low for left channel ( high for right channel)
High for left channel ( low for right channel)

field.name: Prescaler value A
field.description: prescaler division factor for the prescaler A

field.name: Prescaler value B
field.description: prescaler division factor for the prescaler B

field.name: Clock source select
field.description: SIO shift clock source select bit

field.name: Data direction
field.description: This bit controls whether MSB is transmitted first or LSB is transmitted first

field.name: Tx/Rx selection
field.description: This bit decides whether to enable the transmit operation enabled

field.name: Clock edge select
field.description: This bit determines the clock to be used for serial transmit or receive operation

field.name: SIO start
field.description: This bit determines whether the SIO functions is running or has stopped

field.name: SIO mode select
field.description: Determines how and by what SIODATA is read/written

field.name: SIO DATA
field.description: This field contains the data to be transmitted or received over the SIO channel

field.name: SBRDR
field.description: This field contains the prescaler value for the baud rate
